title: Polygon archive-node bor-mainnet, Error after start with snapshots
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`
erigon version 2.48.0-stable-084acc1a

OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX
Running in GKE with image thorax/erigon:v2.48.0

Commit hash: 
Build info                               git_branch=heads/v2.48.0 git_tag=v2.48.0-dirty git_commit=084acc1af2e853ee4a57dbdd6920b6a1e58ef85c

Erigon Command (with flags/config):
erigon --chain=bor-mainnet --datadir=/data/ --bor.heimdall=http://heimdallrest --http --ws --http.api=eth,admin,debug,net,trace,web3,erigon,txpool --authrpc.addr=0.0.0.0 --authrpc.vhosts=heimdallrest --maxpeers=500 --torrent.download.rate=300mb --authrpc.jwtsecret=/secret/jwt.hex

Concensus Layer:
Heimdall (image: 0xpolygon/heimdall:0.3.4)

Concensus Layer Command (with flags/config):
/usr/bin/heimdalld start --home=/heimdall-home

Chain/Network: 
Bor-Mainnet

#### Expected behaviour
After downloading and extracting the snapshot https://snapshot-download.polygon.technology/erigon-mainnet-archive-2023-05-23.tar.zst Erigon should start without errors and read the previous downloaded database.


#### Actual behaviour
Following log entries when starting:
[INFO] [07-12|07:18:10.548] logging to file system                   log dir=/data/logs file prefix=erigon log level=info json=false
[INFO] [07-12|07:18:10.548] Build info                               git_branch=heads/v2.48.0 git_tag=v2.48.0-dirty git_commit=084acc1af2e853ee4a57dbdd6920b6a1e58ef85c
[INFO] [07-12|07:18:10.548] Starting Erigon on Bor Mainnet... 
[INFO] [07-12|07:18:10.550] Maximum peer count                       ETH=500 total=500
[INFO] [07-12|07:18:10.550] starting HTTP APIs                       APIs=eth,admin,debug,net,trace,web3,erigon,txpool
[INFO] [07-12|07:18:10.550] torrent verbosity                        level=WRN
[INFO] [07-12|07:18:12.654] Set global gas cap                       cap=50000000
[INFO] [07-12|07:18:12.656] [Downloader] Runnning with               ipv6-enabled=true ipv4-enabled=true download.rate=300mb upload.rate=4mb
[INFO] [07-12|07:18:12.657] Opening Database                         label=chaindata path=/data/chaindata
[INFO] [07-12|07:18:12.665] Re-Opening DB in exclusive mode to apply migrations 
[INFO] [07-12|07:18:12.673] Apply migration                          name=txs_v3
page_alloc_slowpath:10501 unable alloc 23 pages, flags 0x2, errcode -30792
[EROR] [07-12|07:18:16.621] Erigon startup                           err="migrator.Apply.Up: txs_v3, mdbx_txn_commit_ex: MDBX_MAP_FULL: Environment mapsize limit reached"
migrator.Apply.Up: txs_v3, mdbx_txn_commit_ex: MDBX_MAP_FULL: Environment mapsize limit reached


#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Download the snapshot, extract it and start erigon with it.

I believe it is the same issue like mentioned in this comment: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/2545#issuecomment-1582120183

The downloaded Snapshot archive has a file size of 1.9TB and lies in /data/downloaded-snapshots.
The extracted sizes can be seen here, which is the result of the command "du -h /data":
2.0G    /data/snapshots/db
4.0K    /data/snapshots/history
666.0G  /data/snapshots
4.0K    /data/temp
1.9T    /data/downloaded-snapshots
60.0G   /data/bor
5.7T    /data/chaindata
220.0K  /data/logs
8.3T    /data
